skillTree.localised_description: On his 18th birthday, hordes of Beastmen poured from the forests. They were led by the Bestlord Rargarth and his horde was ten times bigger than anything that had come in living memory. They plundered and burnt the village, killing any man they found. Valten on the other hand, refused to die. He smashed his way to his father's forge, picked up two heavy hammers and set about the horde like a possessed man, looking for Rargarth. A violent fight followed, ending with Valten shattering the beastlord skull and the Beastmen retreating in panic. Word of his victory spread quickly and a number of interested parties came to visit him, to learn of the boy who had become a hero.

One such visitor was Luthor Huss, Prophet of Sigmar, who took Valten to see the Emperor. Karl Franz faced a mighty dilemma. It was likely that the people would want Valten to run The Empire, but this was not the time for political change, as Archaon was advancing on the Empire. Luthor pleaded that Emperor Karl Franz step aside to allow Sigmar's Chosen to take his rightful place on the throne. After long consideration, the Emperor refused to step down, but instead gifted Valten with Sigmar's hammer Ghal Maraz. He proclaimed Valten as the spiritual leader of the Empire and vowed to lead the Imperial armies by his side.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

skillTree.localised_description: Together, Valten and Karl Franz set out to help the besieged city of Middenheim. After the armies Karl Franz had mustered reached their final staging point at Talabheim, Valten was gifted with a suit of Gromril armour from the dwarfs and an elven steed from the High elves. Cheered on by the rank and file, the army headed for Middenheim where they relieved the bloodied yet victorious defenders, forcing Archaon and the remnants of his forces to withdraw.

effects.description: Turns Valten into a Legendary Lord.

skillTree.localised_description: The relentless drive and fury of the Hammer, harnessed for the protection of this ward’s bearer.
Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Heroes of the same type
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Heroes of the same type
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Heroes of the same type

skillTree.localised_description: Valten’s courage knows no limits, and even impossible odds do not faze him.

Valten found Rargarth and was sliced across the chest by the beast scimitar. Rargarth howled in joy and prepared for the killing blow. Valten raised his hammer in defiance just in time and the titanic clash forced Valten to one knee. Valten slowly began to rise, his every limb shaking with the effort until he was on his feet. He kicked out and sent the Beastlord stumbling backwards and hurled his hammer at the beasts head, shattering its skull.

effects.description:
Bonus vs. Large: +5 for flagellants against Beastmen
	(all units in army)

Bonus vs. Large: +10 for flagellants against Beastmen
	(all units in army)

skillTree.localised_description: The Warrior Priest implores Sigmar to imbue him with a modicum of divine strength, and now his hammer glows bright with power!
Valten was instrumental in the defense of The Empire during the End Times against the hords of darkness.

effects.description: Armour Piercing: +5 against Beastmen, Chaos and Norsca

Armour Piercing: +5 for flagellants against Beastmen, Chaos and Norsca
	(all units in army)
Armour Piercing: +10 against Beastmen, Chaos and Norsca

Armour Piercing: +10 for flagellants against Beastmen, Chaos and Norsca
	(all units in army)

skillTree.localised_description: Valten is not a military officer. He does not give rousing speeches or offer rewards to fighters around him, nor does he yell orders or threats in battle. Instead, others are inspired by his awesome presence, and fight even harder as they see Valten strike down foe after foe.

attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

skillTree.localised_description: Valten, Exalted of Sigmar, also known as the Chosen of Sigmar, was a mighty champion of the Empire imbued with a portion of Sigmar's own power.

effects.description:
Upkeep: -20% for Flagellant units
	(all units in army)

skillTree.localised_description: The comet is a powerful omen and his birth caused a great stir. Many believed that Valten would bring pain and suffering to the village and sought to have him cast out and left in the forests or drowned in a river. His parents declared he would be brought up and his father was big enough so that people respected him.
There is nothing but utter belief. There is no reasoning with this one.

After defeating Rargarth, Luthor Huss heard of his deeds and with his conviction, he proclaimed to have found Sigmar reborn and would follow the young boy as he grows to become the leader the Empire needs.
Some creatures charge home with such fury that the very ground shakes beneath their feet.
Such is this one's conviction that others have no choice but to believe.
The war is endless. The cycle of charging, clashing, and bloody hand-to-hand fighting is without end. It will never stop.
The scars on this storied warrior reveal a veteran of many battles, a being not easy to kill and one worthy of respect and fear.

He was blessed with a strange mark on his chest, shaped like the twin-tailed comet of Sigmar, and was also blessed with strength and intelligence, although nothing that would set him apart from another man.
This one fights with a fervour to be both admired and despised.
The Warrior Priest’s faith manifests in the form of a shield as hard as castle-forged steel.
Valten was instrumental in the defense of The Empire during the End Times. He slew many of the Chaos Warriors greatest champions, such as Vardrek Crom and Wulfrik the Wanderer.

target_if: Unit is a Lord or Hero

skillTree.localised_description: This champion extols discipline and fear away from the battlefield as much as on it.

Training action: Unit experience gain is increased by an additional 30%

skillTree.localised_description: The sight of this warrior, their stature, import or infamy, can have a calming effect.

Spread Control action: Control is modified by an additional 2
Spread Control action: Control is modified by an additional 3

skillTree.localised_description: Lying in wait, experienced and patient, striking when the foe least expects.

Assault Units action: Additional 15% casualties inflicted

skillTree.localised_description: Such a champion will not bend or break, but slay in their Lord's name.

Wound action: Additional 12% chance of wounding target
Wound action: Additional 21% chance of wounding target

skillTree.localised_description: "If they know I'm coming then more's the better!"

effects.description: Assault Garrison action: Additional 5% casualties inflicted
Assault Garrison action: Additional 15% casualties inflicted
Assault Garrison action: Additional 30% casualties inflicted

skillTree.localised_description: An expert in their craft, this Hero knows all the mistakes that can be made and how to best avoid making them.

This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.

enabled_if: Leadership is higher than 50% of base

attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

items.colour_text: Forged over two and a half thousand years ago for the Warrior-King Sigmar, this ancient gromril armour was never claimed by the founder of the Empire. Its many runes provide protection against attack and malign magic.

item_set.name: Set of the Heldenhammer
item_set.description: Valten was one of the mightiest warriors alive. Imbued with part of Sigmar's divine essence, it granted him strength beyond any normal man and allowed him to shrug off the most grievous of wounds. He was capable of matching the Everchosen himself in single combat, dominating the fight before Archaon called upon the assistance of U'Zhul.

backgroundSkills.localised_description:
Valten is the Chosen of Sigmar and the heralded rebirth of this divine warrior-god. Valtens birth and apperance concide with a time of great peril. To the north, a Storm of Chaos awashes the shores of the Empire and it has always been said that in their darkest hour, Sigmar himself shall once more return to his people and fight the final battle of the world.
	​
